english: for; on account of; because of

etymology.description: 又(又) (yòu, "hand") + 象(象) (xiàng, "elephant") = hand manipulating an elephant -> abstract idea of action or doing -> cursive simplification to 为(為)
etymology.interpretation: The character originally depicts a hand holding or manipulating an elephant, symbolizing an action or effort. It evolved from the complex representation into its simplified form, 为(為), through cursive script adaptation, while maintaining the original notion of taking action or doing something.
etymology.simplification: 为(為) simplifies the traditional form 為(為) primarily by using cursive script to reduce the number of strokes. The complex 各(各) (gè, "each") was visually compressed into a simpler shape used in 为(為).

examples.chinese: 我为你努力(我為你努力)。
他为胜利奔走(他為勝利奔走)，无惧艰险(無懼艱險)。
examples.pinyin: Tā wèi shènglì bēnzǒu, wú jù jiānxiǎn.
examples.english: He hustles for victory, without fear of hardships.

examples.chinese: 母亲为子女操劳(母親為子女操勞)，总是不辞辛苦(總是不辭辛苦)。
examples.pinyin: Mǔqīn wèi zǐnǚ cāoláo, zǒng shì bù cí xīnkǔ.
examples.english: A mother labors for her children, never complaining about the hardships.
